column4: Quick question, does ubuntu's lilo install autoboot a kernel after an amount of time?
it uses grub
and yes it  defaults to 10 seconds
yes, by default it does, however, grub didnt work on the pc i was working on, so lilo had to be installed instead.
oh makes sense
i knew grub did, was wondering about lilo.
in your lilo.conf theres a line delay = <number>
that shows the delay in tenths of seconds
so 50 = 5 seconds etc.
i'm trying to get lilo set up to autoboot to the desktop after a restart. ;)
yes
cool.
and it's my understanding that if i check the "log in a user automatically on first bootup" and choose a name, that it will automatically log me into the desktop?
yes you can have gdm automatically bypass the login screen and just go straight to desktop
System > Administration > Login Screen Setup is where you can configure it.
shouldnt it require me to input a password somewhere? o.O
i know, i already did.
you can have it automatically select a user and you just have to input the password, yes
err would i be able to start up vnc to enter that password?
or does the remote desktop client not start till after the password has been entered?
I haven;t used vnc in ages sorry.
